<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Utility to embed an integer into a pointer-like type. This is specifically</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><Highlight kind="comment">/// intended to allow embedding integers where fewer bits are required than</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><Highlight kind="comment">/// exist in a pointer, and the integer can participate in abstractions along</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="comment">/// side other pointer-like types. For example it can be placed into a \\c</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="comment">/// PointerSumType or \\c PointerUnion.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Note that much like pointers, an integer value of zero has special utility</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="comment">/// due to boolean conversions. For example, a non-null value can be tested for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="comment">/// in the above abstractions without testing the particular active member.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Also, the default constructed value zero initializes the integer.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> IntT, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Bits = sizeof(IntT) &#42; CHAR&#95;BIT&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pointerembeddedint"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pointerembeddedint/#ad6fb45970333ed1021fa68939785950d">PointerEmbeddedInt</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="normal">  uintptr&#95;t Value = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note: This &#39;&lt;&#39; is correct; using &#39;&lt;=&#39; would result in some shifts</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// overflowing their storage types.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pointerembeddedint/#a4d120b8037d5e9933d98ff076edab2d8"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static&#95;assert</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(Bits &lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">sizeof</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(uintptr&#95;t) &#42; CHAR&#95;BIT,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="normal">                </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Cannot embed more bits than we have in a pointer!&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="normal">  enum : uintptr&#95;t &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We shift as many zeros into the value as we can while preserving the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// number of bits desired for the integer.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="normal">    Shift = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">sizeof</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(uintptr&#95;t) &#42; CHAR&#95;BIT - Bits,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We also want to be able to mask out the preserved bits for asserts.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="normal">    Mask = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static&#95;cast&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">uintptr&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(-1) &lt;&lt; Bits</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
